Indicators  Economy  Cryptocurrency  Insider Trading  Company News  Earnings  Investment Ideas  SWOT Analysis  Analyst Ratings  Transcripts Why UK life insurers’ key profit engine is losing steamAuthorNavamya AcharyaStock MarketsPublished 02/02/2026, 01:39 AMWhy UK life insurers’ key profit engine is losing steamView all comments (0)0LGEN-0.23%AV0.13%PHNX-0.34%MNG-0.13%Investing.com -- Britain’s largest life insurance companies face a sharp slowdown in their most important profit measure as intensifying competition and razor-thin credit spreads squeeze margins in the lucrative pension buyout market.
Unlock exclusive analyst ratings, real-time revisions, and price forecasts with an InvestingPro subscription - now 50% off
The contractual service margin, a crucial metric that represents future profits locked into insurance contracts, is forecast to grow just 1% annually through 2028, down from 5% growth between 2022 and 2024, according to RBC Capital Markets in a recent note.
The CSM serves as a fundamental component of UK life insurers’ valuations but often escapes investor scrutiny.
"The margin outlook for UK PRT remains challenged, driven by new competition, low returning insurer asset strategies, and potential regulatory interventions," the brokerage said
The pension risk transfer market, where insurers take on corporate pension obligations, has become a battleground.
A record 11 insurers competed for deals in 2025, even as total industry volumes fell to roughly £40 billion from £48 billion in 2024, according to figures cited in the report.
Legal & General Group faces the steepest headwinds. RBC forecasts the company’s closing CSM will sit 5% below consensus estimates for 2025, with pension transfers contributing more than half of core operating profit through 2029. The company’s shares trade at 265.10 pence, well below RBC’s 205 pence price target.
Aviva’s CSM projections trail consensus by 2%, while M&G and Phoenix Group have offsetting factors that cushion the blow. Chesnara doesn’t write pension risk transfer business.
Profit margins on new pension buyout deals have deteriorated across the board. RBC expects margins around 2.5% for the current year, compared with historical levels above 3%.
The compression stems partly from what insurance executives described at an industry seminar as historically low liquid investment-grade credit spreads, the premium insurers earn over government bonds.
"With three PRT writers likely under new ownership this year, insurers have stretch capacity to £70bn," the brokerage said, citing consultant LCP. That capacity far exceeds the top-end industry projection of £55 billion in demand.
The Prudential Regulation Authority adds another complication. The UK banking regulator plans to increase capital requirements against offshore reinsurance counterparties, with an update scheduled for the second quarter of 2026. This move particularly affects UK-listed insurance companies.
Despite lower profit margins, capital strain on new deals remained modest in 2025 as companies continued using government bond-based investment strategies rather than riskier assets. Legal & General pioneered these "structured gilt" approaches, significantly reducing upfront capital requirements.
The slowdown carries direct implications for dividend capacity. Phoenix Group’s operating cash generation, the company’s preferred cash metric, is expected to grow 5% to £1.47 billion, supported by recurring management actions worth £548 million.
M&G’s adjusted operating profit is forecast at £802 million, down 4% from the prior year and 4% below consensus.
RBC analysts suggested industry consolidation may emerge given the competitive pressures, though timing remains uncertain as companies report full-year results through late March.Why UK life insurers’ key profit engine is losing steamView all comments (0)0Latest commentsPostComment GuidelinesTrade With A Regulated BrokerIndicesCommoditiesBondsStocksUS 30 48,445.50-447.0-0.91%US 500 6,855.20-83.8-1.21%Dow Jones 48,892.47-179.09-0.36%S&P 500 6,939.03-29.98-0.43%Nasdaq 23,461.82-223.30-0.94%S&P 500 VIX 17.44+0.56+3.32%Dollar Index 96.99+0.131+0.14%Crude Oil WTI Futures61.97-3.24-4.97%Brent Oil Futures65.93-3.39-4.89%Natural Gas Futures3.632-0.722-16.58%Gold Futures4,552.75-192.35-4.05%Silver Futures74.865-3.666-4.67%Copper Futures5.644-0.2800-4.73%US Soybeans Futures1,056.25-8.00-0.75%U.S. 10Y 4.223-0.021-0.49%U.S. 30Y 4.865-0.007-0.14%U.S. 5Y 3.766-0.032-0.84%U.S. 3M 3.674+0.013+0.36%US 10Y T-Note Futures112.03+0.20+0.18%Euro Bund Futures128.18+0.010.00%10-2 Yield Spread 31.32+4.15+15.27%AAPL259.48+1.20+0.46%NVDA191.13-1.38-0.72%GOOGL338.00-0.25-0.07%TSLA430.41+13.85+3.32%AMZN239.30-2.43-1.01%NFLX83.49+0.33+0.40%META716.50-21.81-2.95%Investing ChallengesJoin our investing challenges and compete for rewards while you learn!Take the ChallengeMost Popular ArticlesNewsAnalysisAsia stocks tumble amid AI jitters on Wall St; KOSPI plunges 5%By Investing.co...Feb 02, 2026Gold prices slide 5%, extend losses after Warsh Fed nominationBy Investing.co...Feb 02, 2026How does a weaker dollar impact gold and Bitcoin?By Investing.co...Feb 01, 2026Instant View: Markets plunge as precious metals meltdown spills overBy ReutersFeb 02, 2026Gold, silver selloff deepens after CME hikes marginsBy ReutersFeb 02, 20261 Stock to Buy, 1 Stock to Sell This Week: Alphabet, StrategyBy Jesse CohenFeb 01, 2026Want SpaceX Before the IPO? summary.overview: 英国の大手生命保険会社は、年金リスク移転市場における競争激化と信用スプレッドの縮小により、主要な利益指標である契約サービスマージン（CSM）の成長が大幅に鈍化している。CSMの年間成長率は、2022-2024年の5%から2028年までに1%に低下すると予測されている。
key_points: 契約サービスマージン（CSM）の成長率が2022-2024年の5%から2028年までに1%へ急減する見込み
2025年には記録的な11社が年金買収取引を競い、市場規模は480億ポンドから400億ポンドに縮小
新規年金買収取引の利益率が歴史的な3%超から2.5%程度に悪化
Legal & General Groupが最も厳しい状況で、2025年のCSMがコンセンサス予測を5%下回ると予測
業界の取引能力は700億ポンドに達する一方、需要予測の上限は550億ポンドに留まり供給過剰の状態
英国の健全性規制機構（PRA）が2026年第2四半期にオフショア再保険取引先に対する資本要件を引き上げる計画
summary.market_impact: 英国生命保険セクターの収益性と配当能力が圧迫される見込み。Phoenix Groupの営業キャッシュ創出は5%増の14.7億ポンドと予想されるが、M&Gの調整後営業利益は前年比4%減の8.02億ポンドに減少する見通し。競争圧力により業界再編が進む可能性がある。
summary.related_info: Legal & General Group（株価265.10ペンス、目標株価205ペンス）、Aviva（CSMがコンセンサスを2%下回る予測）、M&G、Phoenix Group、Chesnaraなどが主要な関連企業。RBC Capital Marketsによる分析。
